page.title: 08The River Hamps
page.content: The River Hamps runs past our house. In Waterhouses it goes down a swallow hole nd disappears underground and the river bed is then dried up but in winter it fills up again. Brown trout and rainbow trout live in the river and most of the fishing rights are privately owned. The river starts on Morridge side. It flows through the hills to Onecote and through to Winkhill and Waterhouses, later joining the River Manifold. The River once flooded our house and it took ages to clean it all up. During the flood a lady was rescued through her bedroom window by the quarrymen in a big digger. The river often gets high and comes into our garden. Last winter it froze over and I walked up the river skating on top of the ice.
